Functional impact: Minor impact limited to a single species with minimal impact on overall system functioning.
Minor impact limited to a few (< 10) species with minimal impact on overall system functioning.
Moderate impact on natural state of ecosystems, including impacts on a range of species and some impacts on trophic structure. May include localised physical habitat damage.
Recovery: Average recovery time (> 2 year but < 5 years).

Functional impact: High impact on natural state of an ecosystem (including habitat and/or changes in trophic structure).
Recovery: Slow recovery time (> 5 year but < 10 years).

Functional impact: Extremely heavy impact on the natural state of an ecosystem (including major changes in trophic structure and/or damage to physical structure).
Recovery: Very slow recovery (> 10 years) or permanent damage (e.g. irreversible changes in habitat or trophic structure).
